description: Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
A bucket is an item used to carry water, lava, milk, powder snow, and various aquatic mobs.

A pickaxe is a tool required to mine ores, rocks, rock-based blocks and metal-based blocks quickly and obtain them as items. A pickaxe mines faster and can obtain more block types as items depending on the material it is made from.

An anvil is a gravity-affected utility block used to rename items, combine enchantments and repair items without losing the enchantments. An anvil has limited durability, and as it is used or dropped too far, gradually becomes a chipped anvil, then a damaged anvil, then breaks into nothing.
A stick is an item used for crafting many tools and items.
Flint is a mineral obtained from gravel.
An egg is an item that can be used to craft food items, or thrown for a chance to spawn chicks on impact.
Apples are food items that can be eaten by the player.
Stone is a block found underground in the Overworld or on the surface of mountains.
Hay bales are storage blocks equivalent to nine pieces of wheat. They are used as a crafting ingredient, to feed llamas, horses and horse variants, reduce fall damage or extend campfire smoke.
A lava bucket is a bucket filled with lava.

An enchanting table is a block used to spend experience and lapis lazuli to enchant tools, weapons, armor and books. Enchanting tables draw power from bookshelves placed around them, improving applied enchantments at the expense of level requirement.
An axe is a tool used to hasten the breaking of wood-based or other tough organic blocks, strip or scrape certain blocks, or as a melee weapon that can disable shields it hits.
An axe is a tool used to hasten the breaking of wood-based or other tough organic blocks, strip or scrape certain blocks, or as a melee weapon that can disable shields it hits.
This article is about the block. For repeater circuits, see Transmission circuit § Repeater. For other topics related to redstone, see Redstone (disambiguation).
An enchanted book is an item that lets players add enchantments to certain items using an anvil.
Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.

A pickaxe is a tool required to mine ores, rocks, rock-based blocks and metal-based blocks quickly and obtain them as items. A pickaxe mines faster and can obtain more block types as items depending on the material it is made from.

A minecart with TNT is a block of TNT inside a minecart. Unlike normal TNT it can detonate instantly under certain conditions and its damage and blast radius is increased by its speed when it detonates.
A poisonous potato is a type of potato that can poison the player.
A button is a non-solid block that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed, with two variants.
A milk bucket is a drink obtained from using a bucket on cows, mooshrooms and goats that can be consumed to clear all effects.
Bookshelves are blocks that improve enchantments applied with an enchanting table when placed around one, up to a maximum of fifteen bookshelves, at the expense of level requirement.
A golden apple is a food item that bestows beneficial effects when consumed, and is also used to cure a zombie villager under the Weakness effect into a normal villager.
A hoe is a tool used to harvest certain plant-based or organic blocks more quickly, as well as to till most types of dirt into farmland and convert coarse dirt and rooted dirt to regular dirt.
Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
A hoe is a tool used to harvest certain plant-based or organic blocks more quickly, as well as to till most types of dirt into farmland and convert coarse dirt and rooted dirt to regular dirt.
A rabbit's foot is a brewing item obtained from rabbits.

A pickaxe is a tool required to mine ores, rocks, rock-based blocks and metal-based blocks quickly and obtain them as items. A pickaxe mines faster and can obtain more block types as items depending on the material it is made from.
A water bucket is a bucket filled with water.

The sword is a melee weapon that is mainly used to deal damage to entities or for breaking certain blocks faster than by hand. A sword is made from one of six materials, in order of increasing quality and expense: wood, gold, stone, iron, diamond and netherite.

Slimes are bouncy, cube-shaped hostile mobs that spawn deep underground in particular chunks, or in swamp biomes. They attack by jumping at their targets, come in three sizes and larger slimes can split into smaller ones on death.
A pressure plate is a non-solid block that produces a redstone signal when stood on by an entity, with four variants:
A fermented spider eye is a brewing ingredient.
A pressure plate is a non-solid block that produces a redstone signal when stood on by an entity, with four variants:
Rabbit stew is a food item that can be eaten by the player.
Shovels are tools used to hasten the process of breaking dirt, sand, gravel and other soil blocks, as well as to convert dirt blocks into dirt paths.
A fishing rod is a tool that casts a bobber used to fish in water or to hook and pull mobs, items and some entities towards the user.
A block of redstone is a mineral block equivalent to nine redstone dust. It acts as a permanently powered redstone power source that can be pushed by pistons.
Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
Flint and steel is a tool used to create fire or to ignite certain blocks, structures and mobs.
A beetroot is a food and dye ingredient.
For other kinds of boats, see Boat (disambiguation).

The sword is a melee weapon that is mainly used to deal damage to entities or for breaking certain blocks faster than by hand. A sword is made from one of six materials, in order of increasing quality and expense: wood, gold, stone, iron, diamond and netherite.
Gravel is a gravity-affected block found in the Overworld and the Nether. It is a source of flint, which has a chance to drop when gravel is broken.
Beetroot seeds are items that can be used to plant beetroot crops.
A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.

Stone bricks and the variants cracked stone bricks, mossy stone bricks, and chiseled stone bricks are materials found in structures such as strongholds, igloo basements, jungle temples, ocean ruins, ruined portals, and trail ruins.
Boots are a type of armor that covers the feet of the player. There are six types of boots: leather boots, chainmail boots, iron boots, diamond boots, gold boots, and netherite boots.
Boots are a type of armor that covers the feet of the player. There are six types of boots: leather boots, chainmail boots, iron boots, diamond boots, gold boots, and netherite boots.
A fence is a barrier block that cannot normally be jumped over, similar to a wall. Unlike a wall, a player (but not mobs) can see through the openings in a fence.
Sugar is a food ingredient and brewing ingredient made from sugar canes.
A trapdoor is a solid, transparent block that can be used as an openable 1×1 barrier.

Helmets are a type of armor that covers the head of the player. There are seven types of helmets: leather cap, chainmail helmet, iron helmet, diamond helmet, gold helmet, netherite helmet, and turtle shell.
A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.
Grass is a non-solid plant block that has wheat seeds as a drop. Its color is biome-dependent, and matches the color of grass blocks.
Chestplates are a type of armor that covers the upper body of the player. There are six types of chestplates: leather, chainmail, iron, diamond, gold and netherite.
An axe is a tool used to hasten the breaking of wood-based or other tough organic blocks, strip or scrape certain blocks, or as a melee weapon that can disable shields it hits.
Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
A trapdoor is a solid, transparent block that can be used as an openable 1×1 barrier.

Leggings are a type of armor that covers the lower body of the player. There are six types of leggings: leather pants, chainmail leggings, iron leggings, diamond leggings, gold leggings, and netherite leggings.

A pickaxe is a tool required to mine ores, rocks, rock-based blocks and metal-based blocks quickly and obtain them as items. A pickaxe mines faster and can obtain more block types as items depending on the material it is made from.
Steak (in Java Edition) or cooked beef (in Bedrock Edition) is a food item obtained from cows, mooshrooms, or from cooking raw beef.
Wheat is an item primarily obtained by harvesting fully-grown wheat crops. It is used for crafting as well as to feed certain animals.
Bone blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine pieces of bone meal.
A mushroom is a variety of fungus that grows and spreads in dark areas. Mushrooms generate as red or brown in color, and small or huge in size.
For other kinds of boats, see Boat (disambiguation).
Wheat seeds (in Java Edition) or seeds (in Bedrock Edition) are items obtained by breaking grass, or more abundantly harvested from wheat crops, and are used to plant them.
A bow is a ranged weapon that shoots arrows.
A mushroom block is a solid block that makes up a huge mushroom, which consists of a mushroom stem and brown mushroom blocks or red mushroom blocks, depending on the color of the huge mushroom.
A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.
An axe is a tool used to hasten the breaking of wood-based or other tough organic blocks, strip or scrape certain blocks, or as a melee weapon that can disable shields it hits.
A minecart with chest is a single chest inside a minecart, and functions as such.

Leggings are a type of armor that covers the lower body of the player. There are six types of leggings: leather pants, chainmail leggings, iron leggings, diamond leggings, gold leggings, and netherite leggings.
A fence is a barrier block that cannot normally be jumped over, similar to a wall. Unlike a wall, a player (but not mobs) can see through the openings in a fence.
A button is a non-solid block that produces a temporary redstone signal when pressed, with two variants.
A minecart with furnace is a furnace inside a minecart. It can be powered with coal or charcoal to propel it across a rail line for a limited time, which can be used to move other minecarts.
Boots are a type of armor that covers the feet of the player. There are six types of boots: leather boots, chainmail boots, iron boots, diamond boots, gold boots, and netherite boots.
A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.
A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.

A hopper is a low-capacity storage block that can be used to collect item entities directly above it, as well as to transfer items into and out of other containers. A hopper can be locked with redstone power to stop it from moving items into or out of itself.
An ink sac is an item dropped by a squid upon death used to create black dye, dark prismarine‌, and books and quills.
Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
A hoe is a tool used to harvest certain plant-based or organic blocks more quickly, as well as to till most types of dirt into farmland and convert coarse dirt and rooted dirt to regular dirt.

Helmets are a type of armor that covers the head of the player. There are seven types of helmets: leather cap, chainmail helmet, iron helmet, diamond helmet, gold helmet, netherite helmet, and turtle shell.
A piston is a block capable of pushing most entities and blocks when given a redstone signal.
For other kinds of boats, see Boat (disambiguation).

A pickaxe is a tool required to mine ores, rocks, rock-based blocks and metal-based blocks quickly and obtain them as items. A pickaxe mines faster and can obtain more block types as items depending on the material it is made from.
A minecart is a train-like vehicle entity that runs on rails.
Beetroot soup is an unstackable food item.
A bone is an item primarily obtained from skeletons and similar mobs. It can be crafted into bone meal or used to tame wild wolves.
A pressure plate is a non-solid block that produces a redstone signal when stood on by an entity, with four variants:
Mossy cobblestone is a variant of cobblestone with moss on it. It is mainly used for crafting or as building block.

Helmets are a type of armor that covers the head of the player. There are seven types of helmets: leather cap, chainmail helmet, iron helmet, diamond helmet, gold helmet, netherite helmet, and turtle shell.
Bone meal is a material that can be used as a fertilizer for most plants, as well as a crafting ingredient for dyes.
Shovels are tools used to hasten the process of breaking dirt, sand, gravel and other soil blocks, as well as to convert dirt blocks into dirt paths.
Vines are climbable non-solid vegetation blocks that grow on walls.
Leads are tools used to leash and lead passive and neutral animals, golems and some monsters.
Bowls are containers that can hold certain foods.
A lily pad is a short, flat non-solid block that can be found naturally growing only on water, in swamps and wheat farm rooms in woodland mansions.
A map is an item used to view explored terrain and mark landmarks.
A chest is a block used to store items.

The sword is a melee weapon that is mainly used to deal damage to entities or for breaking certain blocks faster than by hand. A sword is made from one of six materials, in order of increasing quality and expense: wood, gold, stone, iron, diamond and netherite.
Banners are tall decorative blocks, featuring a field that is highly customizable using dyes and banner patterns.
Mushroom stew is a food item.
A chicken is a passive mob found in grass biomes and the main source of chicken, feathers and eggs.
A brick is an item used to craft brick blocks, flower pots, and decorated pots.
Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
Cobblestone is a common block, obtained from mining stone. It is mainly used for crafting or as a building block.
An armor stand is an inanimate entity that can wear armor. It can also hold items and be posed (but these are not possible in Survival in Java Edition).
This article is about the item. For the block, see Clay. For other uses, see Clay (disambiguation).
A cactus is a plant block that generates naturally in dry areas and causes damage.
A wall is a decorative block. Like fences, they can be used to create boundaries, because players and most mobs cannot climb or jump over them.
Books are items used in enchanting and crafting.

A diamond is a rare mineral obtained from diamond ore or loot chests. It is mainly used to craft high-tier tools and armor, enchanting tables, blocks of diamond and jukeboxes, as well as to duplicate smithing templates.
Cake is a food and a block that can be eaten by the player.
Steak (in Java Edition) or cooked beef (in Bedrock Edition) is a food item obtained from cows, mooshrooms, or from cooking raw beef.
Bread is a food item that can be eaten by the player.
Shovels are tools used to hasten the process of breaking dirt, sand, gravel and other soil blocks, as well as to convert dirt blocks into dirt paths.
Clocks are time-telling devices that display the current in-game position of the sun and the moon. Clocks only function properly in the Overworld.
Cooked chicken is a food item that can be eaten by the player.
Coal is a mineral item mainly obtained from coal ore. It is primarily used for crafting torches and campfires, as well as fuel.
A dropper is a low-capacity storage block that can eject its contents into the world or into other containers when given a redstone signal.
Cooked rabbit is a food item that can be eaten by the player.
"Mutton" redirects here. For the raw version, see Raw Mutton.
A firework rocket is an item (and entity) used for creating decorative explosions, boosting when flying with elytra, and loading into a crossbow as ammunition.
Feathers are items dropped by chickens and parrots, as well as tamed cats as morning gifts.
Chestplates are a type of armor that covers the upper body of the player. There are six types of chestplates: leather, chainmail, iron, diamond, gold and netherite.
Cooked porkchop is a food item that can be eaten by the player.
Gunpowder is an item that is used for explosion-related recipes, and as an ingredient in potions.
Iron bars are blocks that serve a similar purpose to glass panes, but made of iron instead of glass.

Obsidian is a block found in all dimensions or created when water flows over a lava source. It has high hardness and blast resistance, rendering it immune to normal explosions. Obsidian is used for crafting and to make the frame for a nether portal. It can only be obtained by mining it with a diamond or netherite pickaxe.
A crafting table is a utility block that gives access to all crafting recipes, including many not available from the inventory's crafting grid.
Iron ingots are versatile metal ingots used extensively in crafting.
A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.
A rabbit is an uncommon passive mob and is a source of rabbit's foot, rabbit hide, and raw rabbit.
For other kinds of boats, see Boat (disambiguation).
Iron nuggets are pieces of iron that can be obtained by smelting iron tools/weapons or iron/chainmail armor. One iron nugget is worth one-ninth of an iron ingot.
A jukebox is a block used to play music discs.
Rabbit hide is an item dropped by rabbits.
A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.
Iron ore is a mineral block found underground. It is a source of raw iron, which can be smelted into iron ingots.
This article is about the item. For the ore, see Lapis Lazuli Ore. For the mineral block, see Lapis Lazuli Block.
Dead bushes are transparent blocks in the form of an aesthetic plant.
A fence is a barrier block that cannot normally be jumped over, similar to a wall. Unlike a wall, a player (but not mobs) can see through the openings in a fence.
Shovels are tools used to hasten the process of breaking dirt, sand, gravel and other soil blocks, as well as to convert dirt blocks into dirt paths.

A note block is a block that emits sounds when attacked, used or powered with redstone. The sound produced can be altered in various ways by using it or putting certain blocks directly above or below it. A note block's sound played repeatedly can be used to direct allays to stay nearby and drop collected items near it.

Leggings are a type of armor that covers the lower body of the player. There are six types of leggings: leather pants, chainmail leggings, iron leggings, diamond leggings, gold leggings, and netherite leggings.
A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.
An item frame is an entity‌ or block entity‌ that displays the item or block that is inside it.
A piston is a block capable of pushing most entities and blocks when given a redstone signal.
A powered rail is a type of rail that either increases or decreases the velocity of minecarts that move over it, depending on its power state.
Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
Leather is an item used to make item frames, armor and books.
Rails are non-solid blocks that provide a path along which minecarts can travel.
A block of lapis lazuli is a storage block equivalent to nine pieces of lapis lazuli.
Dirt is a block found abundantly in most biomes under a layer of grass blocks at the top of the Overworld.
Rotten flesh is a food item that can be eaten by the player, at the high risk of inflicting Hunger.
Redstone dust is a mineral that can transmit redstone power as a wire when placed as a block. It is also used in crafting and brewing.
A book and quill is an item used to write written books.
Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.
A shield is a tool used for protecting the player against attacks.

A redstone torch is a non-solid block that produces a full-strength redstone signal on all sides adjacent to it, except for its attached block, and can power the block directly above it. It deactivates while the block it is attached to is powered.
A baked potato is a food item that can be eaten by the player.
A fence is a barrier block that cannot normally be jumped over, similar to a wall. Unlike a wall, a player (but not mobs) can see through the openings in a fence.
A spider eye is a poisonous food and brewing item.

A cauldron is a block that can contain water, lava or powder snow and, in certain situations, collect it from the environment. In Bedrock Edition, it can also hold potions or dyed water. It also serves as a leatherworker's job site block.
A carrot is a food item obtained from carrot crops that can be used to plant them, eaten or used as a crafting ingredient.
Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.
A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.
A hoe is a tool used to harvest certain plant-based or organic blocks more quickly, as well as to till most types of dirt into farmland and convert coarse dirt and rooted dirt to regular dirt.
A block of diamond is a precious mineral block equivalent to nine diamonds.
Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.
Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.
A furnace is a utility block used for the smelting of blocks and items.
Torches are non-solid blocks that emit light.

The sword is a melee weapon that is mainly used to deal damage to entities or for breaking certain blocks faster than by hand. A sword is made from one of six materials, in order of increasing quality and expense: wood, gold, stone, iron, diamond and netherite.
This article is about the mineral block. For the ore, see Emerald Ore. For the item, see Emerald.
Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.
Glass is a transparent solid block that can be dyed into stained glass, or crafted into tinted glass.
A trapped chest is a variant of the chest that functions similarly, but has a red-tinted latch (with the default resource pack), and produces redstone power while it is open.
Emeralds are rare minerals that are used primarily as the currency for trading with villagers and wandering traders. Naturally-occurring emeralds are rarer than diamonds.
Chestplates are a type of armor that covers the upper body of the player. There are six types of chestplates: leather, chainmail, iron, diamond, gold and netherite.
Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.
Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.
A glass bottle is an item that can hold water, potions, honey, or dragon's breath.
A tripwire hook is a block that emits a redstone signal when it is part of a valid tripwire circuit and it gets triggered by an entity.

Leggings are a type of armor that covers the lower body of the player. There are six types of leggings: leather pants, chainmail leggings, iron leggings, diamond leggings, gold leggings, and netherite leggings.
A potato is a food item obtained from potato crops that can be used to plant them, consumed raw or cooked to make baked potatoes.
Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.
A glass pane is a transparent block that can be used as a more efficient alternative to glass blocks.
Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.
TNT is a block that can be primed by a redstone signal, flint and steel, stray fire, flaming projectile or explosion.
A pumpkin is a fruit block that appears in patches in grassy biomes. Pumpkins have the same texture on all 4 sides.
Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.
Ladders are solid blocks used for climbing walls either vertically or horizontally. They can be placed only on the sides of other blocks.
A block of coal is a storage block, equivalent to nine coal, that can also be used as fuel.
An arrow serves as ammunition for bows, crossbows, and dispensers. Arrows can be modified to give status effects to players and mobs.
Pumpkin seeds are items obtained from pumpkins that can be used to grow pumpkin stems.
A lever is a non-solid block that can provide switchable redstone power.
Grass is a non-solid plant block that has wheat seeds as a drop. Its color is biome-dependent, and matches the color of grass blocks.
A compass is an item used to point to the world spawn or to a lodestone.
A carrot on a stick is an item that can be used to control saddled pigs.

A log or stem is a naturally occurring block found in trees or huge fungi, primarily used as a building block, and to create planks, a versatile crafting ingredient. It comes in ten types: oak, spruce, birch, jungle, acacia, dark oak, mangrove, cherry blossom, crimson and warped.
A pressure plate is a non-solid block that produces a redstone signal when stood on by an entity, with four variants:
A flower pot is a decorative block that can contain flowers, bamboo, saplings, cacti, mushrooms, fungi, and other reasonably small plants.
For other kinds of boats, see Boat (disambiguation).
"Mutton" redirects here. For the raw version, see Raw Mutton.
A hoe is a tool used to harvest certain plant-based or organic blocks more quickly, as well as to till most types of dirt into farmland and convert coarse dirt and rooted dirt to regular dirt.
Chestplates are a type of armor that covers the upper body of the player. There are six types of chestplates: leather, chainmail, iron, diamond, gold and netherite.
A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.
Flowers are non-solid plants that occur in a variety of shapes and colors. They are primarily used for decoration and crafted into dyes.
Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.

The sword is a melee weapon that is mainly used to deal damage to entities or for breaking certain blocks faster than by hand. A sword is made from one of six materials, in order of increasing quality and expense: wood, gold, stone, iron, diamond and netherite.
Bricks are a decorative building block.
A fence is a barrier block that cannot normally be jumped over, similar to a wall. Unlike a wall, a player (but not mobs) can see through the openings in a fence.
Paper is an item crafted from sugar cane.
Boots are a type of armor that covers the feet of the player. There are six types of boots: leather boots, chainmail boots, iron boots, diamond boots, gold boots, and netherite boots.

Clay is a block that can be found abundantly in lush caves, in patches in shallow surface water or converted from mud using pointed dripstone. It can be smelted into terracotta or broken into clay balls which are smeltable into bricks.
A fence gate is a block that shares the functions of both the door and the fence.

Planks are common blocks used as building blocks and in crafting recipes. They are one of the first things that a player can craft in Survival and Adventure modes. Three categories of planks can be differentiated: Overworld planks made from tree logs, bamboo planks made from blocks of bamboo, and nonflammable Nether planks made from huge fungus stems.

Helmets are a type of armor that covers the head of the player. There are seven types of helmets: leather cap, chainmail helmet, iron helmet, diamond helmet, gold helmet, netherite helmet, and turtle shell.

A dispenser is a low-capacity storage block that can fire projectiles, use certain items or tools or place certain blocks, fluids or entities when given a redstone signal. Items that do not have unique dispenser functions are instead ejected into the world.
Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
Porkchop may refer to:
For the removed Pocket Edition block, see Leaves carried.
A gold ingot is a metal ingot used to craft various items, and also used as currency for bartering with piglins.
A jack o'lantern is a solid block that provides light.
Paintings are decorative entities that hang on walls.
Gold nuggets are items used to make gold ingots and other various golden items. One gold nugget is effectively worth one-ninth of a gold ingot.
A melon is a fruit block that grows from a fully-grown melon stem, which in turn is grown from melon seeds.
Sugar cane is a block found as 1–4-block-tall plants near water in the Overworld. As an item, it is an important crafting ingredient.
Shears are tools required to obtain some organic blocks or otherwise mine them faster as well as to shear certain entities and blocks.
Gold ore is a rare mineral block found underground.
A melon is a fruit block that grows from a fully-grown melon stem, which in turn is grown from melon seeds.
Sand is a gravity-affected block found abundantly in deserts and beaches, and less commonly in or near surface water.
Snow is a ground cover block found on the surface in snowy biomes, and can be replenished during snowfall.
Shovels are tools used to hasten the process of breaking dirt, sand, gravel and other soil blocks, as well as to convert dirt blocks into dirt paths.
Melon seeds are items obtained from melon slices that can be used to grow melon stems.
Sandstone is a solid block commonly found in deserts and beaches underneath sand.
Snow is a ground cover block found on the surface in snowy biomes, and can be replenished during snowfall.
Terracotta is a block that comes in the sixteen dye colors (except with a brownish tint), as well as an undyed variant. It is found abundantly in badlands biomes, or can be obtained by smelting clay.
A block of gold is a precious metal block equivalent to nine gold ingots.
A sapling is a non-solid block that can be grown into a tree.
Snowballs are throwable combat items that hit but do not damage most mobs on impact.

A minecart with hopper is a minecart with a hopper inside. Unlike a normal hopper, it pulls items from containers much more quickly, cannot push items into containers, can collect item entities through a single layer of solid blocks and is locked and unlocked via activator rails.
A golden carrot is a valuable food item and brewing ingredient. It provides the second most saturation in the game, behind suspicious stew crafted with either a dandelion or blue orchid.

A sign is a non-solid block that displays text and can be placed on the top or side of other blocks. A hanging sign is an expansive ornamental block that handles a display of larger custom text and can be placed underneath blocks or with a solid self-supporting bracket. The text of both types of signs can be customized with a dye item and a glow ink sac.
String is an item used in crafting recipes such as bows, fishing rods and leads. When placed as a block, string becomes tripwire, which can be combined with tripwire hooks to form a tripwire circuit.
A block of iron is a precious metal block equivalent to nine iron ingots.
Pumpkin pie is a food item that can be eaten by the player.
For other kinds of boats, see Boat (disambiguation).
Wool is a block obtained from sheep that can be dyed in any of the sixteen different colors. It can be used as a crafting material and to block vibrations.
A slimeball is a crafting ingredient commonly dropped by slimes, and can be sneezed out by pandas.
Sandstone is a solid block commonly found in deserts and beaches underneath sand.
A door is a block that can be used as a barrier that can be opened by hand or with redstone.

A bed is a dyeable block that allows a player to sleep and to reset their spawn point to within a few blocks of the bed in the Overworld. If the bed is obstructed or removed, the player spawns at the default world spawning location.
An activator rail is a type of powerable rail that can eject players and mobs from regular minecarts, lock and unlock hopper minecarts and ignite TNT minecarts.
Stairs are blocks that allow mobs and players to change elevation without jumping.
A fence is a barrier block that cannot normally be jumped over, similar to a wall. Unlike a wall, a player (but not mobs) can see through the openings in a fence.
A mushroom is a variety of fungus that grows and spreads in dark areas. Mushrooms generate as red or brown in color, and small or huge in size.
A detector rail is a type of rail that produces a redstone signal when a minecart is on it.
A glistering melon slice is an inedible item used for brewing potions of Healing. It is also one of the many potion ingredients that can be used to make mundane potions.
